intro: Apocopis royleanus, commonly known as the Kashmir Himalayan bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the high altitudes of the Himalayas. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue or violet flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky and alpine environments, thriving in cool and moist conditions. It has narrow, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, clustered flowers that bloom in late summer. Apocopis royleanus is valued for its ornamental beauty and is often found in botanical gardens and conservation areas.
